description: For feasting occasions, this roast recipe is all you need to make a stunning centrepiece, premium sides and a homemade sauce to finish. Pair with good company for a perfect Sunday.
descriptionHTML: For feasting occasions, this roast recipe is all you need to make a stunning centrepiece, premium sides and a homemade sauce to finish. Pair with good company for a perfect Sunday.
descriptionMarkdown: For feasting occasions, this roast recipe is all you need to make a stunning centrepiece, premium sides and a homemade sauce to finish. Pair with good company for a perfect Sunday.
headline: with Butter Bean Mash, Thyme Carrots & a Red Wine Jus
name: Beef Fillet Steak Wellington

steps.instructions:
Preheat your oven to 220°C/200°C fan/gas mark 7. Remove the steaks and puff pastry from your fridge to allow them to come up to room temperature
Chop the mushrooms as finely as you can. Peel and grate the garlic (or use a garlic press).
Trim the carrots (no need to peel). Cut into roughly 1cm wide, 5cm long batons. Destalk the cavolo nero and discard the stems. Thinly slice the leaves widthways. Halve, peel and thinly slice the onion.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large frying pan on high heat. Season the steaks with salt and pepper. Once hot, lay the steaks into the pan and fry until the meat is sealed, 1 min on each side. Once cooked, transfer to a board to rest for a few mins. Brush them with the Dijon mustard.
steps.instructionsHTML:
Preheat your oven to 220°C/200°C fan/gas mark 7. Remove the steaks and puff pastry from your fridge to allow them to come up to room temperature

Chop the mushrooms as finely as you can. Peel and grate the garlic (or use a garlic press).

Trim the carrots (no need to peel). Cut into roughly 1cm wide, 5cm long batons. Destalk the cavolo nero and discard the stems. Thinly slice the leaves widthways. Halve, peel and thinly slice the onion.

Heat a drizzle of oil in a large frying pan on high heat. Season the steaks with salt and pepper. Once hot, lay the steaks into the pan and fry until the meat is sealed, 1 min on each side. Once cooked, transfer to a board to rest for a few mins. Brush them with the Dijon mustard.
steps.instructionsMarkdown:
Preheat your oven to 220°C/200°C fan/gas mark 7. Remove the steaks and puff pastry from your fridge to allow them to come up to room temperature

Chop the mushrooms as finely as you can. Peel and grate the garlic (or use a garlic press).

Trim the carrots (no need to peel). Cut into roughly 1cm wide, 5cm long batons. Destalk the cavolo nero and discard the stems. Thinly slice the leaves widthways. Halve, peel and thinly slice the onion.

Heat a drizzle of oil in a large frying pan on high heat. Season the steaks with salt and pepper. Once hot, lay the steaks into the pan and fry until the meat is sealed, 1 min on each side. Once cooked, transfer to a board to rest for a few mins. Brush them with the Dijon mustard.

steps.instructions:
Reheat the frying pan used for the steak on medium-high heat. Fry the mushrooms and half the thyme until soft and the moisture has cooked off, seaon with salt and pepper, 7-8 mins. Once cooked, set aside to cool. Meanwhile, cut the puff pastry into equal-sized rectangles (2 per person). Place your steaks in the centre of two of the pastry rectangles. Top with the mushrooms. Dampen the edges with a little water.
Gently lay the remaining pastry rectangles on top of each Wellington and enclose the pastry around the steaks, ensuring the pastry sticks directly onto the steaks tightly. Gently press the edges down with the back of a fork to seal the Wellingtons. Using a sharp knife, cut a 1cm border around the steak to remove the excess pastry. Brush the Wellingtons with some egg or milk if you have some.

Once cooked, set aside to cool. Meanwhile, cut the puff pastry into equal-sized rectangles (2 per person). Place your steaks in the centre of two of the pastry rectangles. Top with the mushrooms. Dampen the edges with a little water.

Gently lay the remaining pastry rectangles on top of each Wellington and enclose the pastry around the steaks, ensuring the pastry sticks directly onto the steaks tightly. Gently press the edges down with the back of a fork to seal the Wellingtons. Using a sharp knife, cut a 1cm border around the steak to remove the excess pastry. Brush the Wellingtons with some egg or milk if you have some.
steps.instructionsMarkdown:
Reheat the frying pan used for the steak on medium-high heat. Fry the mushrooms and half the thyme until soft and the moisture has cooked off, seaon with salt and pepper, 7-8 mins. Once cooked, set aside to cool. Meanwhile, cut the puff pastry into equal-sized rectangles (2 per person). Place your steaks in the centre of two of the pastry rectangles. Top with the mushrooms. Dampen the edges with a little water.

Gently lay the remaining pastry rectangles on top of each Wellington and enclose the pastry around the steaks, ensuring the pastry sticks directly onto the steaks tightly. Gently press the edges down with the back of a fork to seal the Wellingtons. Using a sharp knife, cut a 1cm border around the steak to remove the excess pastry. Brush the Wellingtons with some egg or milk if you have some.

steps.instructions:
Carefully transfer the Wellingtons to a lined baking tray. Bake on the top shelf of your oven until the pastry is golden, 20-25 mins. 
Add the carrots to another baking tray, drizzle with oil and sprinkle over the remaining thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Bake ont he middle shelf, 20-25 mins.
When there is 7-8 mins remaining on the carrots, add the cavolo nero to the tray, sprinkle over half the garlic, season with salt and pepper and drizzle with oil, toss to coat. Bake the cavolo nero on the middle shelf until crispy, 7-8 mins.
If you'd prefer, steam-fry the cavolo nero in step 5. Add the cavolo nero and a splash of water to a frying pan and cover for 3-4 mins, then add the garlic and stir fry for 1 min more.
steps.instructionsHTML:
Carefully transfer the Wellingtons to a lined baking tray. Bake on the top shelf of your oven until the pastry is golden, 20-25 mins. 

Add the carrots to another baking tray, drizzle with oil and sprinkle over the remaining thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Bake ont he middle shelf, 20-25 mins.

When there is 7-8 mins remaining on the carrots, add the cavolo nero to the tray, sprinkle over half the garlic, season with salt and pepper and drizzle with oil, toss to coat. Bake the cavolo nero on the middle shelf until crispy, 7-8 mins.

If you'd prefer, steam-fry the cavolo nero in step 5. Add the cavolo nero and a splash of water to a frying pan and cover for 3-4 mins, then add the garlic and stir fry for 1 min more.

Add the carrots to another baking tray, drizzle with oil and sprinkle over the remaining thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Bake ont he middle shelf, 20-25 mins.

When there is 7-8 mins remaining on the carrots, add the cavolo nero to the tray, sprinkle over half the garlic, season with salt and pepper and drizzle with oil, toss to coat. Bake the cavolo nero on the middle shelf until crispy, 7-8 mins.

If you'd prefer, steam-fry the cavolo nero in step 5. Add the cavolo nero and a splash of water to a frying pan and cover for 3-4 mins, then add the garlic and stir fry for 1 min more.

steps.instructions:
Heat a saucepan on medium heat with a drizzle of oil. Once hot, add the onion, season with salt and pepper and fry, stirring occasionally, until golden, 10-12 mins. 
Drain and rinse the butter beans in a sieve.
Add the remaining garlic and the butter beans to the onion pan, along with the water for the beans (see pantry) and chicken stock paste. Warm through 1-2 mins, then mash. Set aside, covered to keep warm.
steps.instructionsHTML:
Heat a saucepan on medium heat with a drizzle of oil. Once hot, add the onion, season with salt and pepper and fry, stirring occasionally, until golden, 10-12 mins. 

Drain and rinse the butter beans in a sieve.

Add the remaining garlic and the butter beans to the onion pan, along with the water for the beans (see pantry) and chicken stock paste. Warm through 1-2 mins, then mash. Set aside, covered to keep warm.
steps.instructionsMarkdown:
Heat a saucepan on medium heat with a drizzle of oil. Once hot, add the onion, season with salt and pepper and fry, stirring occasionally, until golden, 10-12 mins. 

Drain and rinse the butter beans in a sieve.

Add the remaining garlic and the butter beans to the onion pan, along with the water for the beans (see pantry) and chicken stock paste. Warm through 1-2 mins, then mash. Set aside, covered to keep warm.

steps.instructions:
Pour the water for the jus (see pantry for amount) into a small saucepan, bring to the boil on high heat.
Stir in the red wine jus paste, then reduce the heat to medium.
Allow the sauce to bubble and thicken, stirring regularly, 10-12 mins. 
If your red wine jus paste has hardened, put the sachet in a bowl of hot water for 1 min to loosen.
steps.instructionsHTML:

Stir in the red wine jus paste, then reduce the heat to medium.

Allow the sauce to bubble and thicken, stirring regularly, 10-12 mins. 

If your red wine jus paste has hardened, put the sachet in a bowl of hot water for 1 min to loosen.

Pour the water for the jus (see pantry for amount) into a small saucepan, bring to the boil on high heat.

Stir in the red wine jus paste, then reduce the heat to medium.

Allow the sauce to bubble and thicken, stirring regularly, 10-12 mins. 

If your red wine jus paste has hardened, put the sachet in a bowl of hot water for 1 min to loosen.

steps.instructions:
Share the beef fillet Wellingtons between your plates with the butter bean mash, thyme roasted carrots and garlic cavolo alongside.
Pour over the red wine jus to finish.
